Sub:: Contract Labour (Regulation_ bolition Act_1970_and Rules framed_ thereuuder References  have been  received   from various  PIUs  for clarification of certain points regarding implementation of the aforesaid Act. In order to impart first hand knowledge about the various   statutory  provisions related to the responsibilities of NHAI as Principal  Employer, important relevant provisions of the Act is summarized below for information and needful:- Principal Employer: In relation to any office or department of the Government or a local Authority,  the head of that office or department Or such  other officer as the Government Or the local Authority, as the case may be, may specify in this behalf Contractor: A person, who undertakes to produce & given result for the establishment, through contract labour Or who supplies contract labour for any work of the establishment. A sub-contractor is also to be treated as & contractor iii) Contract Labouc: Contract labour is one; who fulfills the following reqhirements - If he is employed in Or in connection with the work of an establighment; and b Ifhe is hired for the above work by O_through a contractor whether with Or without knowledge of Principal Employer. iv) Applicability: The Act iS applicable to every establishment in which 20 or more workmen are employed (or were employed on any in the 12 months) as contract labour). Registratiou_ of Establishment: The Principal Employer shall register the establishment with the registering official [Asstt. Labour CommissionerRRegional Labour Commissioner  (Central) of the region] The   certificate is issued on submission of prescribed application form and payment of fees in the form of Bank Draft: V1 Licence: A contractor employing 20 or more contract labour in any one establishment must  obtain licence by an application to the Asstt. Labour Commissioner (Licensing Officer). He should apply on the prescribed For No IV and enclose a certificate fron Principal Employer in Form No V. He should also enclose two bank drafts covering the amount of licence fee and security deposit   Application for renewal of licence should be made in Form No. VII in triplicate one month before the expiry of licence. If these requirements are met, the licence will be deemed to be renewed. Contd_ day past
